job_tasks.phrase: building Software Solutions to enable our internal and external clients.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly describes the core activity of creating software for clients, which falls under traditional software development.

job_tasks.phrase: gather requirements, define the architecture, manage the development and deployment of Software solutions.
job_tasks.justification: These are all standard software development lifecycle activities, from planning to deployment.

job_tasks.phrase: Working on Internal tool development and external client projects;
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly states the development of software tools and projects, a core software engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: Working as part of Agile development teams;
job_tasks.justification: Working in Agile teams is a common practice in modern software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Managing the development and deployment of software solutions.
job_tasks.justification: This describes the end-to-end process of software delivery, a key software engineering responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Building web applications or work on Data Analysis projects using Python (FastAPI, Django), Javascript (React) and SQL and NoSQL;
job_tasks.justification: Building web applications and working on data analysis projects using specified technologies are core software development and data engineering tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: Learning and using git for version control;
job_tasks.justification: Git is a fundamental tool for version control in software development, which is part of the operational aspects of managing code.

job_tasks.phrase: Completing the documentation tasks as expected by the Project / Product team;
job_tasks.justification: Documentation is an integral part of the software development process.

job_tasks.phrase: As you work on Projects / Products you are expected to learn the Business / Accounting / Finance concepts expected of the Project / Product;
job_tasks.justification: This task involves understanding the business context and domain knowledge, which is crucial for developing relevant software solutions.

soft_skills.phrase: work with in multidisciplinary teams (including deals & technical accounting experts, ERP & technology specialists, software developers and data analysts)
soft_skills.justification: This highlights the need to collaborate with diverse teams.

soft_skills.phrase: Coaching colleagues in the areas of personal growth and development of various consulting skills.
soft_skills.justification: Coaching colleagues is a clear indicator of communication and collaboration skills.

soft_skills.phrase: continuously invest globally in the development of our team members, our skills and the innovative tools that we use
soft_skills.justification: This emphasizes a commitment to continuous learning and skill development.

soft_skills.phrase: You are motivated to complete the onboarding training of the team (Technical & Non-Technical) on time.
soft_skills.justification: This shows a willingness to learn and complete training, indicating adaptability.

soft_skills.phrase: As you work on Projects / Products you are expected to learn the Business / Accounting / Finance concepts expected of the Project / Product;
soft_skills.justification: This requires understanding business concepts relevant to the projects.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses heavily on traditional software development tasks such as building software solutions, web applications, managing development and deployment, and working with standard programming languages and frameworks (Python, JavaScript, React, FastAPI, Django, SQL, NoSQL). There is no mention of AI/ML specific tasks, models, or frameworks. The role is clearly within the scope of Macro-Category A, with no tasks falling into Macro-Category B. Therefore, it is classified as a 'Software Engineer'.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the tasks and technologies involved, which are all standard software engineering practices. There is no ambiguity or mention of AI/ML, making the classification straightforward.
